replies.bodyText: I tried to keep it the same as : https://swagger.io/docs/open-source-tools/swagger-ui/usage/configuration/ . I think that is maybe better ?

replies.bodyText: Maybe that works for copy-pasting, but I'm on the fence about this TBH.
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
No, we need to be consistent with the Quarkus way. Just remove the name everywhere.
This will be auto-documented in the doc (if the configuration reference has been added to the doc).
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: If we later want to support the external config file from swagger-ui, names in the config will then be different. If we are ok with that, then I am happy. Personally, I used the swagger-ui documentation, and got caught a few times with the camelCase to camel-case in Quarkus, but might just be me.

replies.bodyText: All config options is made Optional, because what we are doing is building the html. Even though some options, like displayOperationId, has a default, the default is in the swagger-ui code, so we just want to change the html, if set. So the default for us is nothing (not in the html) and when set, we add the value to the html. Else, even with the default case, we are parsing variables that is not needed when we create the html. Hope that makes sense.
